refnamediv.refpurpose: compute and check SHA384 message digest

refsect1.title: DESCRIPTION
refsect1.para: Print or check SHA384 (384-bit) checksums. With no FILE, or when FILE is -, read standard input.

listitem.para: read SHA384 sums from the FILEs and check them

refsect2.title: The following four options are useful only when verifying checksums:

listitem.para: don't print OK for each successfully verified file
don't output anything, status code shows success
exit non-zero for improperly formatted checksum lines
warn about improperly formatted checksum lines

The sums are computed as described in FIPS-180-2. When checking, the input should be a former output of this program. The default mode is to print a line with checksum, a character indicating input mode ('*' for binary, space for text), and name for each FILE.
GNU coreutils online help: <http://www.gnu.org/software/coreutils/> Report sha384sum translation bugs to <http://translationproject.org/team/>

refsect1.title: AUTHOR
refsect1.para: Written by Ulrich Drepper, Scott Miller, and David Madore.

refsect1.title: SEE ALSO
refsect1.para: The full documentation for sha384sum is maintained as a Texinfo manual. If the info and sha384sum programs are properly installed at your site, the command
should give you access to the complete manual.
